address: Xã Vang Quới Tây, Huyện Bình Đại, Tỉnh Bến Tre
thought:
**Address Mapping Analysis: Xã Vang Quới Tây, Huyện Bình Đại, Tỉnh Bến Tre**

Okay, let's break this down. My task is to map this old Vietnamese address to its current administrative structure, and I've got the data I need to do it effectively.

First, the province. "Tỉnh Bến Tre" rings a bell.  I need to check for any mergers, and, as I recall, Resolution 60-NQ/TW is the place to start.  Bingo! That document clearly states that Bến Tre was merged with Vĩnh Long and Trà Vinh, becoming "Tỉnh Vĩnh Long". So, "Tỉnh Bến Tre" now maps to "Tỉnh Vĩnh Long". Simple enough.

Next, the ward. "Xã Vang Quới Tây"... this requires a deeper dive.  I know I need to check the "Other resolutions," particularly those related to ward restructuring.  A quick scan of the documents leads me directly to  1687/NQ-UBTVQH15 concerning Vĩnh Long province. Line 99 hits the mark! It explicitly states that "Xã Vang Quới Tây" was merged with other wards to form "Xã Lộc Thuận". This is exactly what I was looking for.

Now, to solidify this, I'll confirm that "Xã Lộc Thuận" is indeed registered in the "New wards" list for "Tỉnh Vĩnh Long".  The data confirms it: `{"ward_code":"29077","ward_name":"Xã Lộc Thuận","province_name":"Tỉnh Vĩnh Long"}`. Perfect match!

Since this match is clear-cut, the confidence level is high. The resolution directly addresses the very ward in question.

My final output will be an array containing a single object. That object will include the relevant citation from the resolution, the province name "Tỉnh Vĩnh Long", the ward code "29077", the ward name "Xã Lộc Thuận" and a "high" confidence rating to show the certainty of the match. All is well.

citation.header: 1687/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Vĩnh Long
citation.line: 99. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Vang Quới Đông, Vang Quới Tây và Lộc Thuậnthành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Lộc Thuận.
